abstract.p: EarthLink, Internet service provider, is shifting its advertising account to TBWA/Chiat/Day from BBDO West (M)

block.p: EarthLink, an Internet service provider, is changing agencies after only 14 months, shifting its account to the Playa del Rey, Calif., office of TBWA/Chiat/Day, part of TBWA Worldwide, from BBDO West in Los Angeles, part of BBDO Worldwide. Both agencies are owned by the Omnicom Group.

Spending by Earthlink for 2000 was estimated at $60 million. The brand campaign that TBWA/Chiat/ Day will create for the fourth quarter has an estimated budget of $30 million; product ads are to begin running in August.

EarthLink, an Internet service provider, is changing agencies after only 14 months, shifting its account to the Playa del Rey, Calif., office of TBWA/Chiat/Day, part of TBWA Worldwide, from BBDO West in Los Angeles, part of BBDO Worldwide. Both agencies are owned by the Omnicom Group.

Spending by Earthlink for 2000 was estimated at $60 million. The brand campaign that TBWA/Chiat/ Day will create for the fourth quarter has an estimated budget of $30 million; product ads are to begin running in August.

The shift was not unexpected because TBWA/Chiat/Day is the agency for Apple Computer and ''Apple is a strategic partner of ours,'' said Arley Baker, a spokesman for EarthLink in Atlanta. EarthLink was undeterred, he added, by the recent dismissal of TBWA/Chiat/Day by a large client, the Taco Bell unit of Tricon Global Restaurants.
''We're not pushing chalupas or Chihauhuas,'' Mr. Baker said, referring to a Taco Bell product and its advertising mascot, ''so we feel comfortable they could do a great job for us.''
